control

Class FileControl

  • java.lang.Object
    • control.FileControl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IFileControl

    public final class FileControl
extends java.lang.Object
implements IFileControl
    FileControl.java In accordance with Singleton Pattern. The only class that connects with FileWrapper.
    Author:
    Matti, Peter

      private void addAdditionalCustomers(org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Sheet sheet, java.util.ArrayList<Customer> inputList, int row)
      addAdditionalCustomers - a rather tricky method, its designed to add additional customers for sheets, the arraylist consists of a customer amount from 1-3 due to the fact that the mainCustomer is allso added to this list, but we just ignore the mainCustomer in these methods, whenever we hit it, we just continue in any given loop.

    • Method Detail

      • addAdditionalCustomers

        private void addAdditionalCustomers(org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Sheet sheet,
                          java.util.ArrayList<Customer> inputList,
                          int row)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        addAdditionalCustomers - a rather tricky method, its designed to add additional customers for sheets, the arraylist consists of a customer amount from 1-3 due to the fact that the mainCustomer is allso added to this list, but we just ignore the mainCustomer in these methods, whenever we hit it, we just continue in any given loop. the reason why we can make this a single method for all sheets is due to the fact that additional customers only get added their name/cpr/address, and their cells/columns in the different sheets are all very alike- we have 2 variations - which is Ovf 1 and Ovf 2 - but those are atleast the same, so we just plus the cells/columns with whatever numbers needed if we hit one of those, and reset the numbers for each Customer
        Parameters:
        sheet -
        inputList -
        row -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • checkForCustomerDir

        public boolean checkForCustomerDir(Customer customer)
        Method is used for checking if a customer directory exists, and if it doesn't, we try to create one for the given customer.
        Specified by:
        checkForCustomerDir in interface IFileControl
        Parameters:
        customer - customer is used to to identify the correct folder
        Returns:
        boolean return whether a new folder was created or not

      • createExcel

        public java.io.File createExcel(Customer inputCustomer,
                       int logId,
                       java.util.ArrayList<Customer> inputList)
                         throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                java.lang.Exception
        createExcel - the main method in this class, it's the one that creates the customerFile, copies the masterExcel sheet into the customerFile(that is actually a functionality that should've been split up into another method and this should've just taken in a file as parameter), we create all of the variables used for all of the excel methods in this class in this method, we set the font, the style, address, name etc. it's also this class where we make the XSSF-WorkBook, and the sheet variable given as parameter to all of the methods. we also have to call sleep a couple of times because this method is so dependant on the progressBar being updated during and after. we return a file in order to save the newly made excelfile.
        Specified by:
        createExcel in interface IFileControl
        Parameters:
        inputCustomer - Customer object to base excel file on
        logId - Id of the log
        inputList - Arraylist to include in file
        Returns:
        file - newly created Excelfile
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        java.lang.Exception

      • getFile

        private java.io.File getFile(java.lang.String... paths)
        getFile method. takes in a various amounts of Strings and makes a String[] - creates a new StringBuilder object of which it appends word for word and puts a fileseperator inbetween. and in the end - returns a file.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        File

      • makeAddress

        private java.lang.String makeAddress(Customer inputCustomer)
        Making the address useing a final String space in order to limit CPU time, and we also just create one object, the String builder instead of making 9 different String objects.
        Parameters:
        inputCustomer - The customer to create an address string for
        Returns:
        String the combined address from a given inputcustomer.
